OBSERVATION:
- Pattern 1: The max-activation token is consistently a finite form of the English auxiliary/copular ‚Äúbe‚Äù or contracted "'s": "'s" (3.422), "is" (3.250, 2.656), "was" (2.266, 1.977, 1.703), "were" (1.820), "are" (1.711).
- Pattern 2: These forms typically follow pronouns (she/he/it/they) and often occur inside ‚Äúthat‚Äù-clauses: ‚Äúthat he is‚Äù (3.250/2.656), ‚Äúthat it was‚Äù (1.977), ‚Äúthat they are‚Äù (1.711).
- Pattern 3: The top exemplar "'s" occurs in ‚Äúshe's been craving‚Äù where "'s" = has (present perfect), showing the feature fires on contracted "'s" even when it is ‚Äúhas,‚Äù not ‚Äúis‚Äù (3.422).
- Pattern 4: Complements after the be-form vary (adjective ‚Äúred,‚Äù past participle ‚Äúburied,‚Äù adjective ‚Äúdestined,‚Äù progressive ‚Äúfacing‚Äù), indicating the feature is not tied to a specific predicate type.
- Common elements: Finite ‚Äúbe‚Äù morphology (is/was/are/were) and contracted "'s"; pronoun subjects (he/she/it/they); frequent ‚Äúthat + pronoun + be‚Äù subordinate clause context; stronger activations for present 3rd-singular forms ('s, is) than past/plural forms.

[HYPOTHESIS LIST]:
Hypothesis_1: This feature detects finite forms of the English verb ‚Äúto be‚Äù (is/was/are/were) and contracted "'s" functioning as auxiliaries/copulas, especially immediately following pronouns and within ‚Äúthat‚Äù-clauses. Predicted strong activation on tokens: ‚Äúis/was/are/were/‚Äôs‚Äù in ‚Äúthat he is‚Ä¶,‚Äù ‚Äúit was‚Ä¶,‚Äù ‚Äúthey are‚Ä¶,‚Äù ‚Äúshe‚Äôs ‚Ä¶‚Äù.

Hypothesis_2: The feature is sensitive to the contracted clitic "'s" regardless of whether it means ‚Äúis‚Äù or ‚Äúhas,‚Äù with particularly strong activation on "'s" (e.g., ‚Äúshe‚Äôs been‚Ä¶,‚Äù ‚Äúhe‚Äôs happy‚Äù). Prediction: high activation on "'s" in both ‚Äúhe‚Äôs tall‚Äù and ‚Äúhe‚Äôs been waiting,‚Äù potentially > corresponding uncontracted ‚Äúis/has‚Äù.

Hypothesis_3: Negative control: Possessive "'s" (e.g., ‚ÄúJohn‚Äôs book‚Äù) and non-‚Äúbe/have‚Äù linking verbs (e.g., ‚Äúseems,‚Äù ‚Äúbecomes,‚Äù ‚Äúappears‚Äù) will not strongly activate this feature. Prediction: near-baseline activation on the "'s" in ‚Äúthe teacher‚Äôs desk‚Äù and on ‚Äúseems/becomes.‚Äù

Hypothesis_4: Tense/number preference: The feature prefers present 3rd-singular (‚Äúis,‚Äù ‚Äú‚Äôs‚Äù) over past/plural forms (‚Äúwas/were/are‚Äù), mirroring observed magnitudes ('s 3.422 > is 3.250/2.656 > was 2.266/1.977/1.703 ‚âà were 1.820 > are 1.711). Prediction: ‚ÄúShe is ‚Ä¶‚Äù / ‚ÄúShe‚Äôs ‚Ä¶‚Äù > ‚ÄúHe was ‚Ä¶‚Äù ‚âà ‚ÄúThey were ‚Ä¶‚Äù > ‚ÄúThey are ‚Ä¶‚Äù in activation strength.
